724042f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Square South - Sullivan Street
724042f-a.text:
47-40 Washington Square South, west from Sullivan to Macdougal Streets. These houses will be drastically remodeled about 1923. At the time of this picture Sullivan Street had only recently been out through the block from West Third Street, thus causing the demolition for 48-49 Washington Square. 49 Washington Square had been the Westmore Home for Fallen and Friendless Girls (established 1881).

Notice the old horse-car track alongside the more modern electric track.

September 8, 1905.

Brown Brothers, Photographers.
724042f-a.folder: Washington Square South & Sullivan Street, Manhattan, NY

724037f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Square South - Sullivan Street
724037f-a.text:
07-40 Washington Square South, west from Sullivan to Macdougal
Streets.
Compare with Brown Brothers' photo of this block in 1905, a year or two after Sullivan Street had been cut through from West Third Street. As shown here, the buildings are shortly to be remodelled
into apartments and studios.
About 1922.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
724037f-a.folder: Washington Square South & Sullivan Street, Manhattan, NY
